title: After Chief Minister, Bihar's Deputy CM Promotes Electric Cars By Using Tata Tigor EV
text:
Bihar state government’s top officials have been promoting the use of electric vehicles. Nine electric vehicles were taken on lease for the same from Energy Efficiency Services Ltd (EESL) for five years. One of them was spotted being used by deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi on Saturday.

This came to light when the deputy CM arrived at the launch of state government's 'Jal-Jeevan-Hariyali' campaign. The campaign aims to boost green cover in the state, while also taking care of the depleting water level. Bihar CM Nitish Kumar launched around 35,000 schemes under the new campaign with a total budget of close to Rs 1600 crore.

Nitish Kumar himself was spotted using an electric car - Tata Tigor EV back in July, as he arrived for the monsoon session of the Bihar state assembly. When asked about his experience in the eco-friendly car, he had said "It is a pleasure travelling in this car. It is almost soundless and its design feels very comfortable while sitting inside".

वायु प्रदूषण को कम करने तथा इलेक्ट्रिक वाहन को बढ़ावा देने के उद्देश्य से आज इलेक्ट्रिक वाहन की सवारी शुरू करते हुए। pic.twitter.com/SFGIIi2kAQ — Sushil Kumar Modi (@SushilModi) October 26, 2019

As for Modi, who is also the Environment, Forest and Climate Change Minister, a recent press release by his office mentioned that the minister will only be using the Tata Tigor EV from now on, specifically for his commute “within the city”.

Tata Tigor EV has been empowering official commute in India for long now. Though it was just recently launched for the general public at a starting price of Rs 9.44 lakh. It stands as the only electric vehicle apart from the Mahindra eVerito and the recently inducted Hyundai Kona to serve the Indian government officials till now. The adoption of such electric cars increased after the Finance Ministry directed all government bodies to prefer electric vehicles over IC engine ones for official use.

In addition to the CM and the deputy CM, the electric cars will also be used by the state Assembly speaker, Legislative Council chairman as well as the chief secretary. The idea is to promote the notion of using an electric vehicle for cutting down on the use of petrol and diesel, thus saving the environment in the process.
description: Bihar Deputy CM was recently spotted using an electric car for his commute. The incident is second of its kind after the state's chief minister arrived at the monsoon session of the state assembly in an electric car. Clock to know what the state's top officials are doing to promote the use of these electric vehicles.
